intro: Erigeron cabelloi, commonly known as the Cabello's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, linear leaves. It produces small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron cabelloi is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
